en.sc1: We will illustrate using a freelist by performing a series of list operations. Let's start from an empty singly linked list and a freelist variable pointing to null.
en.sc2: Now insert a new node with value 8 to the current node.
en.sc3: Since the freelist is empty, we must use the new operator to create a new node for insertion.
en.sc4: Here is the list after inserting 20, 6 and 12. So far, we have not been able to take advantage of the freelist.
en.sc5: Now remove the current node from the list. Set its value to be null. The deleted node is moved to the head of freelist for later reuse.
en.sc6: The list after another delete operation of the current node. Again put the deleted node at the head of the freelist.
en.sc7: Now let's insert a node with value 6 to the current position. This time the head node of the freelist is reused.
